ngoName: National Centre for Human Settlements and Environment
address: National Centre for Human Settlements and Environment, E-5/A, Girish Kunj, Arera Colony,Bhopal - 462016 Madhya Pradesh
title: National Centre for Human Settlements and Environment
detailsOfAchievement: The organisation vision is to view all human settlements and activities holistically instead of compartmentalising them. Simultaneously, to look at every aspect of a settlements and its impact on people, their economy, their rights and entitlements, their social structure, the environment in which they live, etc. Therefore, NCHSE dedicates itself to its mission of participatory sustainable development of the area and its people with special focus on weaker section of the society for a rapid social mobilisation and significant economic development. NCHSE is presently functioning through its six divisions. 1. Research and socio-economic surveys division. 2. Project Implementation division. 3. Monitoring and evaluation division. 4. Computers and GIS & IT application division. 5. Consumer grievances redressal division. 6. Training division. The centre has so far implemented over 300 projects in various districts of Madhya Pradesh and in other states which include Karnataka, Tamil Nadu, Jammu and Kashmir, Haryana, Delhi, West Bengal, Orissa, Gujarat, Chhattisgarh and Maharashtra. We have completed watershed projects in Vidisha, Sehore, Jhabua, Ujjain, Shajapur, Hoshangabad, Dhar districts total area of 57851.52 ha. & total cost of projects Rs.2430.53 lakhs in M P during the year 1996 to 2004. Presently our organisation implementing NREGS watershed projects in Hoshangabad, Dhar, Jhabua district in MP. total area of 22636.55 ha. the total cost of projects Rs. 1810.92 lakhs. An NCHSE project in Jhabua on :Environmental and Soil Degradation Control", was awarded for the United Nations Environment Programmes International Award in the year 1995.

detailsOfAchievement: Ojaswini Samdarshi Nyas, has been working in the field of Education, Women Empowerment, Social & Cultural activities since 1992. The primary objective of the Nyasâ€™s activities and programs is to provide a platform to socio-economically weaker sections of the society especially women, to strengthen themselves. 1. Education: In 2001 the Nyas established a Science & Commerce College with subjects like Biotechnology, Micro Biology and Computers being introduced for the first time in the district. In 2003 the Nyas started a Hindi medium school. This was followed by the establishment of an English medium school in the year 2010 (CBSE recognized), Engineering college at Damoh in 2007 and at Sagar in 2008 (AICTE recognized, affiliated to RGPV), Nursing colleges at Damoh in 2006 and at Sagar in 2007 (recognized by INC), ITI colleges at Damoh and Sagar in June 2014 (approved by NCVT, New Delhi). The educational institutions were started with the aim to provide quality education to socio-economically weak sections of the society at a nominal fee. The colleges provide access to education and employment for the students and the staff and faculty. While a professional degree has its benefits, it is not for all. This was the reason behind opening the I.T.I. Colleges; to skill the youth in various professions and make them employable as well as create entrepreneurship opportunities, courses include â€“ plumbing, welding, fitter, diesel mechanic, electrician, and wireman. 2. Promotion of arts and crafts: The Nyas started organizing Crafts Bazaars in the year 2005 at Bhopal, and subsequently at Jabalpur and Sagar. The aim of the crafts bazaar is to contribute to the promotion and revival of local arts and crafts, provide a platform for artisans from across the country, to help crafts people get a fair price for their products, to create opportunities for cross pollination of ideas and techniques, to make local arts more accessible to people, and be an enabler in making handicrafts mainstream products. Through these annual exhibitions, the Nyas also encourages women entrepreneurs and SHGâ€™s. The main focus of the Nyas for the last 3 years has been to provide direct market linkages of buyers and sellers through its Crafts Bazaar and Gandhi Shilp Bazaar. The Nyas also conducts numerous welfare activities e.g. â€“ health camps, sanitation workshops, etc. Many beneficiaries of these activities include artists and crafts people. 3. Livelihood: The Nyas has undertaken many programs to provide livelihood to people and create entrepreneurship opportunities in the district of Damoh. â€¢ Ojaswini Grih Udyog was established in 2001, which makes and sells papad, pickles, and spices. Over 200 women have been benefited by the skilling and employability endeavours of the Grih Udyog. â€¢ The Nyas also established a stitching and tailoring unit, to provide free of cost training to needy girls and women. Here women are not only trained in the craft, but are also employed to undertake small-scale projects. â€¢ More than 8 educational institutions run by the Nyas are a source of livelihood to more than 800 families, and are the single largest employer in the Damoh district. 4. One of the first programs of the Nyas was the establishment of a Womenâ€™s Magazine in 1993 called â€œOjaswiniâ€, to act as a voice for womens issues and grievances and to be a step towards the empowerment of women.

detailsOfAchievement: â€œOSIYAN SHIKSHA PRASAR SAMITI â€œ is training Partner of NDLM and P training Partner of Telecom sector skill council .Our society has been conducting self- designed vocational training programmes in the fields of Finance, Marketing, Agriculture, Computer, Banking & Investment, etc. since 2006 and also have experience of conducting and handling various projects of MSME GOVT OF INDIA, NSDC,MORD,SGSY etc. We have lots of experience of conducting vocational training programmes and other training progammes like for SC/ST/OBC/BPL and Female candidates. :- Financial Management Training Programme Data Entry Operator Programme Tally Accounting Certification Programme Banking Operations Programmes Marketing Executive Training programmes Tele â€“Marketing Training Programmes Tele caller Training Programme Women Empowerment Agricultural Development Programmes Dairy Farming Programmes in Rural Areas Water Harvesting Programmes Soil-Conservation Programmes We have successfully conducted various Programmes and Schemes involving skill Development and Training to Students of Special categories as well as General Category. MSME (MINISTRY OF MICRO,SMALL AND MEDIUM ENTERPRISES): Society has been associated with MSME and has conducted Following Programmes successfully under Skill Development Programmes. 1. Financial Management Programme. 2. House Wiring Programme. 3. Computer Accounting With Tally Programme. 4. Human Resource Management Programme. 5. Supply Chain Management Programme. STAR NSDC SCHEME: Society has Implemented monetary reward scheme of STAR NSDC as Associate Training Partner(ATP) in Domestic Data entry Operator Sector. Under this scheme Training has been Provided to the students and certificates has been issued to qualified Students. RASHTRIYA SAKSHARTA MISSION -IT EDUCATION (RSMIT EDUCATION): Society has Implemented Swarnjayanti Gram Swarojgar yojna (SGSY) of Ministry of Rural Development for Placement of Rural BPL Youth through its association with Rashtriya Saksharta Mission â€“IT Education .Under this scheme training has been provided to the students in the fields of Tally(SGSY IT â€“Tally ) and Retail (SGSY RET â€“Sales Person ). ASSOCIATED WITH ILFS FOR SUPPLY OF MANPOWER: Society has worked for one year with ILFS by supplying trained candidates for data entry work.

detailsOfAchievement: Pancham Nishad Sangeet Sansthan aims to strive at bridging the prevailing gap between the Academic Institution and the tradional Guru Shishya Parampara.The Institution is endeavor to fulfill socio-cultural commitments.Pancham Nishad Sangeet Sansthan (A society registered in 2002,and located at Bhawanipur Colony near Annapurna Temple,Indore) is dedicated to preserving and promoting Hindustani Classical Music tradions of Indian Culture.The main activities of Institution are to arrange concerts of exceptional quality by the upcoming,known unknown artists from all over the India. Pancham Nishad Sangeet sansthan is run by commitee members and volunteers only and functions as a Non profit organization. In addition to arranging concerts Pancham Nishad sangeet Sansthan also facilitates educational activities through school of Music Our Aims-(1)To promot Indian Classical Music with its richness of tradition and talent by providing a worthy platform for performance. (2)To Foster love for the arts by proving a showcase of the finest exponents. (3)To facilitate teaching and demonstration of Traditional arts through lecture demo and seminars,workshop. (4) To inculcate in coming generations a desire to learn and continue this rich tradition through a Guru Shishya relationship with leading mastero.
